member.name: T:LtiAdvantage.Constants.OidcClaims
member.summary: Subset of OpenID standard claims used by LTI Advantage. See https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#Claims.

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Constants.OidcClaims.Email
member.summary: End-User's preferred e-mail address. Its value MUST conform to the RFC 5322 [RFC5322] addr-spec syntax. The RP MUST NOT rely upon this value being unique.

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Constants.OidcClaims.FamilyName
member.summary: Surname(s) or last name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple family names or no family name; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Constants.OidcClaims.GivenName
member.summary: Given name(s) or first name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple given names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Constants.OidcClaims.Locale
member.summary:
End-User's locale, represented as a BCP47 [RFC5646] language tag. This is typically an ISO 639-1 Alpha-2 [ISO639‑1] language code in lowercase and an ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 [ISO3166‑1] country code in uppercase, separated by a dash. For example, en-US or fr-CA. As a compatibility note, some implementations have used an underscore as the separator rather than a dash, for example, en_US; Tools MAY choose to accept this locale syntax as well.
en-US

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Constants.OidcClaims.MiddleName
member.summary:
Middle name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple middle names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters. Also note that in some cultures, middle names are not used.
"Marie"

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Constants.OidcClaims.Name
member.summary:
End-User's full name in displayable form including all name parts, possibly including titles and suffixes, ordered according to the End-User's locale and preferences.
"Ms Jane Marie Doe"

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Constants.OidcClaims.Picture
member.summary:
URL of the End-User's profile picture. This URL MUST refer to an image file (for example, a PNG, JPEG, or GIF image file), rather than to a Web page containing an image. Note that this URL SHOULD specifically reference a profile photo of the End-User suitable for displaying when describing the End-User, rather than an arbitrary photo taken by the End-User.
"http://example.org/jane.jpg"

member.summary: Properties of the context from which the launch originated (for example, course id and title).

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.ContextClaimValueType.Id
member.summary: An opaque identifier that identifies the context where the launch originated. Must be unique within the scope of the tool_consumer_instance_guid.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.ContextClaimValueType.Label
member.summary: A plain text label for the context.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.ContextClaimValueType.Title
member.summary: A plain text title of the context.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.ContextClaimValueType.Type
member.summary: An array of URI values that identify the type of context. The list MUST include a URN value drawn from the LIS vocabulary. The assumed namespace of these URNs is the LIS vocabulary so Tools can use the handles when the intent is to refer to an LIS context type. If the Platform wants to include a context type from another namespace, a fully qualified URN should be used.

member.name: T:LtiAdvantage.Lti.ContextType
member.summary: Represents LIS Context Types

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Lti.ContextType.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown course type. Examine the claim directly.

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Lti.ContextType.CourseTemplate
member.summary: A course template is the abstract course which is independent of when it is taught. The course template may have one or more course offerings, each of which may have one or more course sections.

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Lti.ContextType.CourseOffering
member.summary: A course offering relates to the specific period of time when the course is available.

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Lti.ContextType.CourseSection
member.summary: A course section is the specific instance into which students are enrolled and taught.

member.name: F:LtiAdvantage.Lti.ContextType.Group
member.summary: A course group within a course section.

member.summary: The Tool is being launched within a new browser window or tab.

member.name: T:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LaunchPresentationClaimValueType
member.summary: Information to help the Tool present itself appropriately.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LaunchPresentationClaimValueType.DocumentTarget
member.summary: The type of 'browsing context' the launch occurred in. See https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/browsers.html#sec-browsing-contexts.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LaunchPresentationClaimValueType.Height
member.summary: The height in pixels of the window or frame where the content from the tool will be displayed.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LaunchPresentationClaimValueType.Locale
member.summary:
End-User's locale, represented as a BCP47 [RFC5646] language tag. This is typically an ISO 639-1 Alpha-2 [ISO639‑1] language code in lowercase and an ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 [ISO3166‑1] country code in uppercase, separated by a dash. For example, en-US or fr-CA. As a compatibility note, some implementations have used an underscore as the separator rather than a dash, for example, en_US; Tools MAY choose to accept this locale syntax as well.
en-US

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LaunchPresentationClaimValueType.ReturnUrl
member.summary: Fully qualified URL within the tool platform interface to which the tool can redirect the user when it's done. An lti_log or lti_errormsg parameter may be added as a query parameter.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LaunchPresentationClaimValueType.Width
member.summary: The width in pixels of the window or frame where the content from the tool will be displayed.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Audiences
member.summary: REQUIRED. Audience(s) for whom this ID Token is intended i.e. the Tool. It MUST contain the OAuth 2.0 client_id of the Tool as an audience value. It MAY also contain identifiers for other audiences. In the general case, the aud value is an array of case-sensitive strings. In the common special case when there is one audience, the aud value MAY be a single case-sensitive string.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.DeploymentId
member.summary: The required https://purl.imsglobal.org/spec/lti/claim/deployment_id claim's value contains a string that identifies the platform-tool integration governing the message.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Lti11LegacyUserId
member.summary: User ID as defined in LTI 1.1.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.MessageType
member.summary: The type of LTI message.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Nonce
P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Roles
member.summary: An array of roles as defined in the Core LTI specification.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.TargetLinkUri
member.summary: The tool's url.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.UserId
member.summary: The required 'sub' claim's value contains a string acting as an opaque identifier for the user that initiated the launch. This value MUST be immutable and MUST be unique within the platform instance.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Version
member.summary: The version to which the message conforms. Must be "1.3.0".

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Context
member.summary: Properties of the context from which the launch originated (for example, course id and title).

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Custom
member.summary: This is a map of key/value custom parameters which are to be included with the launch.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.LaunchPresentation
member.summary: Information to help the Tool present itself appropriately.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Lis
member.summary: Properties about available Learning Information Services (LIS), usually originating from the Student Information System.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Platform
member.summary: Properties associated with the platform initiating the launch.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.RoleScopeMentor
member.summary: An array of the user_id ('sub' claim) values which the current user can access as a mentor.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Email
member.summary:
End-User's preferred e-mail address. Its value MUST conform to the RFC 5322 [RFC5322] addr-spec syntax. The Tool MUST NOT rely upon this value being unique.
"jane@example.org"

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.FamilyName
member.summary:
Surname(s) or last name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple family names or no family name; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.
"Doe"

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.GivenName
member.summary:
Given name(s) or first name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple given names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.
"Jane"

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.MiddleName
member.summary:
Middle name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple middle names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters. Also note that in some cultures, middle names are not used.
"Marie"

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Name
member.summary:
End-User's full name in displayable form including all name parts, possibly including titles and suffixes, ordered according to the End-User's locale and preferences.
"Ms. Jane Marie Doe"

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.Lti.LtiRequest.Picture
member.summary:
URL of the End-User's profile picture. This URL MUST refer to an image file (for example, a PNG, JPEG, or GIF image file), rather than to a Web page containing an image. Note that this URL SHOULD specifically reference a profile photo of the End-User suitable for displaying when describing the End-User, rather than an arbitrary photo taken by the End-User.
"http://example.org/jane.jpg"

member.name: T:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.GetMembershipRequest
member.summary: Represents a GetMembership request.
member.remarks: Does not support membership differences. See https://www.imsglobal.org/spec/lti-nrps/v2p0#membership-differences.

member.name: M:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.GetMembershipRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.Nullable{LtiAdvantage.Lti.Role})
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.
member.param: Optional limit to the number of members to return.
Optional resource link filter for members with access to resource link.
Optional role filter for members that have the specified role.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.GetMembershipRequest.ContextId
member.summary: Required context ID of the membership context. For example, the course from which to get the membership.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.GetMembershipRequest.Limit
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of members to return.
member.remarks: This parameter is merely a hint. The server is not obligated to honor this limit and may at its own discretion choose a different value for the number of members to return. See https://www.imsglobal.org/spec/lti-nrps/v2p0#limit-query-parameter

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.GetMembershipRequest.Rlid
member.summary: filter for members to return.
member.remarks: The ID of a resource link within the context. The result set will be filtered so that it includes only members that are permitted to access the resource link. If omitted, the result set will include all members of the context with access to any resource. See https://www.imsglobal.org/spec/lti-nrps/v2p0#resource-link-id-query-parameter.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.GetMembershipRequest.Role
member.summary: filter for members to return.
member.remarks: The result set will be filtered so that it includes only those memberships that contain this role. The value of the parameter should be the full URI for the role, although the simple name may be used for context-level roles. If omitted, the result set will include all members with any role. See https://www.imsglobal.org/spec/lti-nrps/v2p0#role-query-parameter.

member.name: T:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.IMembershipController
member.summary: Marker for ILogger dependency injection.

member.name: T:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member
member.summary: Represents a member in the Membership container of the Membership service.
member.remarks: Member must not contain more information about the person than would be included in a basic launch. For example, if PII is not sent in basic launch from the same context, it should not be included in member. See https://www.imsglobal.org/spec/lti-nrps/v2p0#membership-container-media-type.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.Email
member.summary: The primary email address for the person. Not specified if not included in a basic launch from same context.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.FamilyName
member.summary: The person's assigned family name. Not specified if not included in a basic launch from same context.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.GivenName
member.summary: The person's assigned first name. Not specified if not included in a basic launch from same context.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.Message
member.summary: Contains context and resource link specific message parameters.
member.remarks: Included with when the membership list is filtered to users who can access a specific resource link. See https://www.imsglobal.org/spec/lti-nrps/v2p0#membership-container-media-type.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.Name
member.summary: The person's assigned full name (typically their first name followed by their family name separated with a space). Not specified if not included in a basic launch from same context.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.Picture
member.summary: A URL to an image for the person. Not specified if not included in a basic launch from same context.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.Roles
member.summary: The role/s this member has in the context. Does not include non-context roles.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.LisPersonSourcedId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the person as provisioned by an external system such as an SIS.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.Status
member.summary: Membership status is either Active or Inactive. Defaults to Active if not specified.
member.remarks: Use Deleted when reporting differences if membership no longer exists. See https://www.imsglobal.org/spec/lti-nrps/v2p0#membership-status.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.UserId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the person. Corresponds to the "sub" claim.

member.name: P:LtiAdvantage.NamesRoleProvisioningService.Member.Lti11LegacyUserId
member.summary: If the user id is changing with the migration to LTI 1.3, a platform should include the lti11_legacy_user_id as an additional member attribute. It should contain the userId value from LTI 1.1 Names and Roles Provisioning Service 1.0 for that same user.
